QuestionStem: Which animal do you think is the pollinator of the heliconia flower?

options.Feedback: Compare the shape and size of the heliconia flower with the features of the long-nosed bat.
options.ImageAlt: In this photograph, the face of a bat is shown.

options.Feedback: The Hercules beetle has large jaws. Do you think these are adaptations for pollination or defense?
options.ImageAlt: This photograph shows a beetle with a structure that extends from the front of its head.
This photograph shows the very long, slender bill of a hummingbird.

FinalIncorrectFeedback: The green hermit hummingbird is the only animal pollinator of the heliconia plant. The size and shape of its beak match the size and shape of the heliconia flower.

image.altText: This photograph shows flowers that have a very long and narrow shape. The pollen is located deep inside the flowers.
